citeinfo.othercit: This is a link to the broader USGS Alaska Science Center research project supported by these data. Users will find a description of the research project and links to associated reports, publications, and data products.

descript.abstract: These data are part of the Gulf Watch Alaska (GWA) long-term monitoring program. This dataset consists of observations of sea otter (Enhydra lutris) fecal samples (spraint). Observers examined fresh spraint piles to identify major prey classes in the samples and to determine sea otter diets in the Gulf of Alaska region.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this dataset is to allow comparisons of sea otter spraint data metrics across time and geographic location. Metrics include: predominance and presence/absence of major prey categories. Comparisons also include metrics from one location over time or from one time across locations. Sampling was conducted within regions of Alaska including: Kachemak Bay (KBAY), Kenai Peninsula (KEP; Kenai Fjords National Park (KEFJ)), Alaska Peninsula (AKP; Katmai National Park and Preserve (KATM)), and Prince William Sound (PWS; northern [NPWS] and western Prince William Sound).

spdom.descgeog: Katmai National Park and Preserve, Kachemak Bay, Kenai Fjords National Park, Prince William Sound

idinfo.datacred: Many people (USGS staff, contractors, and volunteers, NPS staff and volunteers, and NOAA staff) contributed to collection of the spraint observations contained in this data set. The Nearshore Component Principal Investigators involved in this effort include: Brenda Ballachey, James Bodkin, Heather Coletti, Tom Dean, Dan Esler, George Esslinger, Kim Kloecker, Mandy Lindeberg, Dan Monson, Brian Robinson, Sarah Traiger, and Ben Weitzman.
idinfo.native: The original data are stored as a Microsoft Access database in a Windows operating environment but have been exported as comma separated text files (.csv) for dissemination.

citeinfo.title: Evidence of Increased Mussel Abundance Related to the Pacific Marine Heatwave and Sea Star Wasting
citeinfo.othercit: Traiger, S.B, Bodkin, J.L., Coletti, H.A., Ballachey, B., Dean, T., Esler, D., Iken, K., Konar, B., Lindeberg, M.R., Monson, D., Robinson, B., Suryan, R.M., Weitzman, B.P., 2022. Evidence of increased mussel abundance related to the Pacific marine heatwave and sea star wasting. Marine Ecology e12715. doi:10.1111/maec.12715

attracc.attraccr: These data are presence and absence information based on visual examination of spraint (fecal) samples. Only fresh, intact samples were examined. Predominant designation (greater than 50 percent of the sample) was also based on visual examination of each sample after they were spread out by the observer. After returning from the field, all data was entered in the Microsoft Access database and rows were checked against field data sheets for missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies.

dataqual.logic: All attribute values fall within expected ranges and duplicate data does not exist in the dataset.
dataqual.complete: The dataset is complete and no data were omitted.

horizpa.horizpar: Spraint sampling locations were collected using hand-held GPS (3-m accuracy; WGS84).

method.methdesc: Sea otter spraint (scat) was examined to determine the relative proportion of prey items and to provide supplemental information on the diet of sea otters. Spraint is generally found above the high tide line in areas where sea otters haul out, especially during winter. Observers recorded the relative abundance of various prey items within ten haphazardly selected spraint per site. Only spraint that was relatively fresh (with some organic material still present) was examined. Observers also noted the predominant prey item as well as the presence and approximate proportion of any other identifiable prey in each spraint sample.

citeinfo.title: Gulf Watch Alaska Nearshore Component: Monitoring Site Locations from Prince William Sound, Katmai National Park and Preserve, and Kenai Fjords National Park

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Geological Survey, Alaska Science Center

citeinfo.othercit: Coletti, H.A., Kloecker, K.A., Bodkin, J.L., Dean, T.A. 2017. Gulf Watch Alaska nearshore component: monitoring site locations from Prince William Sound, Katmai National Park and Preserve, and Kenai Fjords National Park: U.S. Geological Survey data release. doi:10.5066/F78S4N3R

procstep.procdesc: Field data recorded on paper field data sheets and then entered into a Microsoft Access database. This was usually completed while still in the field or back at the support vessel. Data are .csv outputs from the database.
Field data sheet QAQC: the field crew and the field data manager review the data sheets for missing, illegible, or confusing entries and correct any issues.
Spreadsheet QAQC: overall site level data and prey species data are checked against the field data sheets and also checked row by row and cell by cell for accuracy and completeness.
Lab data sheet QAQC: the lab crew and then a data manager review the data sheets for missing, illegible, or confusing entries and correct any issues.
Spreadsheet QAQC: Prey species presence and absence datasets are checked against the field data sheets and lab data sheets for completeness and logical consistency.

spdoinfo.indspref: Spatial information in this data set include named locations and geographic coordinates in decimal degrees.

enttyp.enttypd: Table with sea otter spraint sampling data for Kachemak Bay, Prince William Sound, Katmai National Park and Preserve, and Kenai Fjords National Park. Presented in a Comma Separated Value (CSV) formatted table.

attr.attrdef: Largest spatial unit of the Gulf Watch Alaska Nearshore Monitoring component.
Two-digit unit number for each block within each sampling region.
Name of sampling block within each sampling region, as defined in Coletti et al. 2017, https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R.

edom.edomvd: Katmai National Park and Preserve (Block 10, Region = Alaska Peninsula)
Kachemak Bay (Block = undefined, Region = Kachemak Bay)
Kenai Fjords National Park (Block 05, Region = Kenai Peninsula)
Northern Prince William Sound (Block 07, Region = Prince William Sound)
Western Prince William Sound (Block 08, Region = Prince William Sound)

attr.attrdef: Identification code of the nearest sampling site within each sampling block, as defined in Coletti et al. 2017, https://doi.org/10.5066/F78S4N3R, and Dean et al. 2014. The 'SiteID' is comprised of 4 parts, 1) the region (AKP, KBAY, KEP, PWS), 2) the block number (04, 05, 07, 08, or 10), 3) the sampling type (described below), and 4) the sample type number (01-05). Spraint data collection sometimes occurs well outside the geographic proximity of sites relative to other metrics.
attr.attrdefs: Coletti et al. 2017 and Dean et al. 2014

edom.edomvd: Sampling type = Rocky Intertidal Intensive Block
Sampling type = Rocky Intertidal Extensive Block

attr.attrdef: A general name indicating the area of sampling within each sampling block. Due to the different sampling regime, these do not follow site names defined in Coletti et al. 2017. In some instances, a 'SiteName' may have multiple haulout locations.
Date the spraint sample was collected. A null value "." indicated that the sampling date was not recorded.
Year the spraint sample was collected.
The name given to the location within each 'SiteName' where the sea otter spraint was sampled. When different from 'SiteName', 'Haulout' indicates are more specific geography.
Latitude (decimal degrees) of the sample location. This is a general location of an area and not the individual spraint sample location.
Longitude (decimal degrees) of the sample location. This is a general location of an area and not the individual spraint sample location.
Number of spraint observations at a given location. A null value "." indicates that the number of spraint observations was not recorded.
A code that signifies the amount of clam species observed in a sea otter spraint sample. A null value "." indicates that the amount of clam species observed in the spraint was not recorded.

edom.edomvd: Clam species absent from spraint sample.
Clam species present in the spraint sample.
Clam species are predominant in the spraint sample.

attr.attrdef: A code that signifies the amount of crab species observed in a sea otter spraint sample. A null value "." indicates that the amount of crab species observed in the spraint was not recorded.

edom.edomvd: Crab species absent from spraint sample.
Crab species present in the spraint sample.
Crab species are predominant in the spraint sample.

attr.attrdef: A code that signifies the amount of mussel species observed in a sea otter spraint sample. A null value "." indicates that the amount of mussel species observed in the spraint was not recorded.

edom.edomvd: Mussel species absent from spraint sample.
Mussel species present in the spraint sample.
Mussel species are predominant in the spraint sample.

attr.attrdef: A code that signifies the amount of urchin species observed in a sea otter spraint sample. A null value "." indicates that the amount of urchin species observed in the spraint was not recorded.

edom.edomvd: Urchin species absent from spraint sample.
Urchin species present in the spraint sample.
Urchin species are predominant in the spraint sample.

attr.attrdef: A code that signifies the amount of other species (not listed in the previous attributes) observed in a sea otter spraint sample. A null value "." indicates that the amount of other species observed in the spraint was not recorded or other species were not observed.

edom.edomvd: Other species absent from spraint sample.
Other species present in the spraint sample.
Other species are predominant in the spraint sample.

attr.attrdef: Identification of the species type in the 'Other' attribute. A null value "." indicate that other species were not recorded or other species were not present in the spraint sample.

attrdomv.udom: Common name for the species type(s) in the 'Other' attribute.

edom.edomvd: Unknown species type present in the spraint sample.

attr.attrdef: Comments referring to spraint samples. Blank cells indicate that notes were not recorded.

enttyp.enttypd: Table with a list of principle investigators and contributors to the sea otter spraint sampling component of Gulf Watch Alaska. Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing data.

attr.attrdef: The last name of a Gulf Watch Alaska contributor.

attrdomv.udom: The last name of a Gulf Watch Alaska contributor.

attr.attrdef: The first name of a Gulf Watch Alaska contributor.

attrdomv.udom: The first name of a Gulf Watch Alaska contributor.

attr.attrdef: The ORCID (Open Researcher and Contributor ID) for each collaborator. Blank cells indicate that the contributor does not have an ORCID or the ID is unknown.

attrdomv.udom: The ORCID (Open Researcher and Contributor ID) for each collaborator.

attr.attrdef: The position title of the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor.

attrdomv.udom: The position title of the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor.

attr.attrdef: The agency who the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor is associated with.

attrdomv.udom: The agency who the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor is associated with.

attr.attrdef: The program within the agency who the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor is associated with. Blank cells indicate that the contributor is not associated with a program.

attrdomv.udom: The program within the agency who the Gulf Watch Alaska contributor is associated with.

distinfo.resdesc: The U.S. Geological Survey, Alaska Science Center is the authoritative source and distributor of these data.
distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data for other purposes or on all computer systems, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. Any use of trade, firm, or product names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.

digtinfo.formcont: Data are distributed in a Zip package containing data in CSV format and FGDC metadata in XML and HTML formats.
digtinfo.filedec: Compression applied by the 7-Zip utility using the default compression level [5]. The Zip package can be decompressed and unpacked by open source or commercially available unzip tools.
